form.IN:
Besedo
gotten
/g*Qt@0n/
v ameriški angleščini pogosto uporabljamo kot obliko za pretekli deležnik.

sense.def:
Get
ima pogosto enak pomen kot
become
. Na primer: kadar nekaj
gets cold
, postane hladno.

seg.quote: She began to get suspicious.
If things get worse, you'll have to come home.
It's getting late.

sense.def:
Get
lahko uporabljamo namesto pomožnega glagola
be
, kadar tvorimo trpni ali pasivni naklon.

seg.quote: Suppose someone gets killed.
He failed to get re-elected.

sense.def:
To get into a particular state or situation
pomeni znajti se v določenem stanju ali položaju.

seg.quote: He got into trouble with the police.
I began to get in a panic.

sense.def:
To get
pomeni tudi premikati se ali nekam prispeti.

seg.quote: When the train stopped, he got off.
Nobody can get past.
When we got to Firle Beacon we had a rest.
What time do they get back?

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
ADJUNCT
or
COMPLEMENT

sense.def:
To get someone or something into a particular position, state, or situation
pomeni povzročiti, da se nekdo ali nekaj znajde v določenem položaju, stanju ali okoliščinah.

seg.quote: I got Allen into his bunk.
The girl finally got the door open.
He got her pregnant.

sense.def:
To get someone to do something
pomeni nekoga prositi ali mu ukazati, naj nekaj naredi, in tisti človek uboga.

seg.quote: She gets Stuart to help her.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
PAST PARTICIPLE

sense.def:
To get something done
pomeni poskrbeti, da je nekaj narejeno.

seg.quote: I got safety belts fitted.

sense.def:
To get something
pomeni nekaj dobiti ali prejeti.

seg.quote: He's trying to get a flat.
I got the anorak for Christmas.
He was with us when we got the news.
Get advice from your local health department.

gramGrp.pos:
VB
with
OBJ
and
OBJ,
or
VB
with
OBJ
and
‘for’

sense.def:
To get something for someone
pomeni nekomu nekaj prinesti ali mu nekaj dobaviti.

seg.quote: Get me a glass of water.
He got her a job with the telephone company.

sense.def:
To get the time or opportunity to do something
pomeni imeti čas ali priložnost, da nekaj storimo.

seg.quote: We get little time for sewing.

sense.def:
To get a particular idea or feeling
pomeni imeti ali doživeti določeno zamisel ali čustvo.

seg.quote: I got the impression he'd had a sleepless night.
She got a lot of fun out of sweeping the front porch.

sense.def:
To get an illness or disease
pomeni zboleti za določeno boleznijo.

seg.quote: She got chicken pox.

sense.def:
To get to do something
pomeni končno nekaj storiti.

seg.quote: The Prime Minister got to hear of the rumours.
I got to like the whole idea.
We never got to see the play.

sense.def:
To get moving
ali
to get going
pomeni začeti se premikati ali nekaj delati.

seg.quote: We can't seem to get moving.

sense.def:
To get to a particular stage in an activity
pomeni doseči neko stopnjo v dejavnosti.

seg.quote: You have got to an important stage in your career.
I got as far as dismantling the plug.

sense.def:
To get a train or bus
pomeni potovati z vlakom ali avtobusom.

seg.quote: We got the train to Colchester.

sense.def:
To get a person or an animal
pomeni ujeti, zajeti v past ali ustreliti osebo ali žival;

seg.quote: The police got him in the end.
What gets me is the way Janet implies that I'm lazy.

sense.def:
To get a joke
ali
to get the point of something
pomeni, da šalo ali bistvo nečesa razumemo.

seg.quote: I don't really get the point of the story.

sense.def:
Ljudje pogosto rečejo
you get
namesto
there is
ali
there are
, kadar hočejo povedati, da nekaj obstaja, se zgodi ali je mogoče doživeti.

seg.quote: You get some rather curious effects.

sense.def:
To get an idea or argument across
pomeni doseči, da ljudje razumejo neko zamisel ali dokaz.

To get along with someone
pomeni imeti z nekom prijateljski odnos.

seg.quote: The two men get along well.

sense.def:
To get around
pomeni iti v številne različne kraje, ker je tak naš življenjski slog.

Kadar novica
gets around
,
gets about
ali
gets round
zanjo izve veliko ljudi in postane znana.

seg.quote: The news got around.
Startling rumours began to get about.

sense.def:
To get around a difficulty or restriction
ali
to get round a difficulty or restriction
pomeni uspešno se izogniti težavi ali omejitvi ali ukrepati proti njej.

seg.quote: To help get around this problem, some tanks are now equipped with radar.

sense.def:
To get at something
pomeni nekaj uspešno doseči ali pridobiti.

seg.quote: The goats bent down to get at the short grass.
I don't know what you are getting at.

sense.def:
To be getting at someone
pomeni nekoga kritizirati ali dražiti;

To get away from somewhere
pomeni uspešno zapustiti neki kraj.

seg.quote: You've got to get away from home.

sense.def:
To get oneself away
ali
to get away
pomeni pobegniti.

seg.quote: They got away through Mrs Barnett's garden.

sense.def:
To get away with something
pomeni ne biti kaznovan za nekaj, kar smo naredili, pa ne bi smeli.

seg.quote: He bribed her—and got away with it.

sense.def:
To get something back
pomeni znova imeti nekaj, kar smo nekoč že imeli.

seg.quote: He hoped he would get back his old job.

sense.def:
Get back
rečemo nekomu, ko hočemo, da se odmakne.

To get back to what one was doing before
pomeni znova začeti delati tisto, kar smo že delali.

seg.quote: Eddie wanted to get back to sleep.
He got back to work again.

sense.def:
To get back to a previous state or level
pomeni vrniti se k prejšnjemu stanju ali ravni.

seg.quote: Things would soon get back to normal.

sense.def:
To get by in a situation
pomeni uspešno preživeti neke okoliščine ali se jim postaviti po robu.

seg.quote: He had managed to get by without much reading or writing.

sense.def:
To get down to something
pomeni začeti nekaj delati.

seg.quote: I got down to work.

sense.def:
Kadar vlak, avtobus ali letalo
gets in
, prispe.

seg.quote: What time does the coach get in?

sense.def:
Kadar neka politična stranka ali politik
gets in
, je izvoljen.

To get a remark in
pomeni v pogovoru končno nekaj povedati.

seg.quote: ‘What I wanted to say,’ I finally got in, ‘is that I've a set of instructions at home.’

sense.def:
To get in on an activity
pomeni začeti sodelovati pri neki dejavnosti, morda tudi brez povabila;

seg.quote: ‘He even gets in on the photography shows,’ she said indignantly.

sense.def:
To get into an activity
pomeni začeti opravljati neko dejavnost ali biti udeležen pri njej.

seg.quote: I always get into arguments with people.
He was determined to get into politics.

sense.def:
To get into a school, college, or university
pomeni biti sprejet na neko šolo, kolidž ali univerzo kot učenec ali študent.

What has got into you?
vprašamo, kadar se nekdo vede nepričakovano;

To get something off
pomeni nekaj odstraniti.

seg.quote: Get your shirt off.
I got most of the mud off your clothes.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
gets off with a small punishment
, so mu naložili zelo majhno kazen za kršenje zakona ali pravila.

seg.quote: He expressed relief that he had got off so lightly.

sense.def:
Get off
ali
get your hands off
rečemo osebi, kadar ji dopovedujemo, da se nečesa ne sme dotakniti.

To get off with someone
pomeni z nekom začeti ljubezenski ali spolni odnos ali zvezo;

seg.quote: Mike thinks I'm trying to get off with his girlfriend.

sense.def:
To get a piece of clothing on
pomeni nadeti si oblačilo.

seg.quote: Get your coat on.

sense.def:
To get on with someone
pomeni imeti prijateljski odnos z nekom.

seg.quote: Mother and I get on very well.

sense.def:
To get on with an activity
pomeni nadaljevati neko dejavnost ali jo začeti.

seg.quote: Perhaps we can get on with the meeting now.

sense.def:
To be getting on well or badly
pomeni dobro ali slabo napredovati.

seg.quote: I always get on far better if I can draw a diagram.

sense.def:
To get on
pomeni tudi biti uspešen v karieri.

seg.quote: She's got to study to get on.

sense.def:
To be getting on
pomeni biti ostarel;

seg.quote: They have getting on for a hundred stores.

sense.def:
To get on to a particular topic
pomeni začeti govoriti o določeni témi.

seg.quote: Somehow we got on to grandparents.

sense.def:
To get on to someone
pomeni navezati stik s kom.

seg.quote: I'll get on to her right away.

sense.def:
To get out of a place or organization
pomeni zapustiti neki kraj ali organizacijo.

seg.quote: I'm going to get out of New York.
The Alliance? The sooner we get out the better.

sense.def:
To get something out
pomeni nekaj vzeti s kraja, kjer je spravljeno.

seg.quote: He got out a book and read.

sense.def:
To get out of doing something
pomeni izogniti se nekemu delu ali opravilu.

seg.quote: She always got out of washing up.

sense.def:
Kadar novica ali podatek
gets out
, postane znan.

seg.quote: The word got out that he would go ahead with the merger.

sense.def:
To get a stain out
pomeni očistiti madež.

To get over an unpleasant experience or an illness
pomeni opomoči si od neprijetnega doživetja ali bolezni.

seg.quote: Have you got over the shock?

sense.def:
To get over a problem
pomeni uspešno rešiti neko težavo.

seg.quote: One mother got over this problem by leaving her baby with someone else.

sense.def:
To get something unpleasant over with
pomeni storiti ali pretrpeti nekaj neprijetnega, ker se tako odločimo.

seg.quote: Can we just get this questioning over with?

sense.def:
To get round to doing something
ali
to get around to doing something
pomeni nekaj storiti po določenem odlogu, ker smo bili prej preveč zaposleni ali se nam je upiralo tisto storiti.

To get through a task
pomeni uspešno dokončati neko nalogo.

seg.quote: It is extremely difficult to get through this amount of work in such a short time.

sense.def:
To get through an unpleasant experience or time
pomeni uspešno preživeti neprijetno izkušnjo ali čas.

seg.quote: They helped me to get through that time.

sense.def:
To get through a large amount of something
pomeni popolnoma porabiti večjo količino nečesa.

seg.quote: I got through about six pounds worth of drink.

sense.def:
To get through to someone
pomeni doseči, da nekdo razume, kaj poskušamo povedati;

seg.quote: Howard, how do I get through to you?

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo pri telefoniranju
gets through
, s človekom na drugi strani vzpostavi zvezo.

seg.quote: I finally got through at twenty past ten.

sense.def:
To get together
pomeni sestati se z ljudmi, da bi se o nečem pogovorili ali preživeli nekaj časa skupaj.

To get something together
pomeni nekaj narediti ali organizirati.

seg.quote: He's spent a whole afternoon trying to get the thing together.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo sedi ali leži in potem
gets up
, se dvigne v stoječ položaj.

seg.quote: The woman got up from her chair with the baby in her arms.

sense.def:
To get up in the morning
pomeni zjutraj iti iz postelje in se obleči.

seg.quote: You've got to get up at eight o'clock.

sense.def:
To get up to something
pomeni, da nekdo nekaj dela, zlasti nekaj takega, česar ne odobravamo;

seg.quote: When I found out what they used to get up to I was horrified.
